Khalātiya Petavatthu：The story of a courtesan．She had beautiful hair which，however，she lost，owing to the machinations of a rival．She once stole clothes from some men who lay asleep，and on another occasion gave alms to a monk．She was later born in an ocean vimāna as a naked peta with lovely hair； some merchants，while going to Suvannabhūmi，saw her，and on learning her story gave clothes on her behalf to a pious man in their company，and as a result clothes immediately appeared on her．Later the merchants gave alms to the Buddha in her name，and she was born in Tāvatimsa．Pv．i．10； PvA．46ff．
